reviews.review: Das beste Shooter game ! :) Mutter aller Ego-Shooter ;) sollte jeder "Zocker" haben !

Counter-Strike 1.6 got me into shooters and PC-games in general, Source bound me to them. With all the available mods and insane range of maps, and the fact that you start every match from relative scratch, this is a shooter you'll enjoy for hundreds if not thousands of hours. Game modes include Team Deathmatch, Plant/Defuse the Bomb, Gungame and Turbo Gungame. There's no rewards to be gained in the form of skins, perks or leveling up and that's what makes it so attractive both casually and competitively. Yes, there's a good chance you'll play with people who've played for years. But they don't have an equipment or upgrade advantage because of it. Everyone starts the match with the same amount of cash and same weapon so getting more money and an early weapon advantage all depends on how well you perform. And if you're a FPS player in general then you're probably on equal footing skill-wise as well. 

This game has proven itself year after year after freaking year, even with its also great successor being out for a while now.

10/10 this will always be my favourite game involving guns.

Many would predict that they only had space for one source mulitplayer FPS on their steam library. With TF2 taking up most of the popularity these days, it can be easy to forget about this addictive hell of a game; Counter Strike:Source. It might not quite have that particular charm you got from the spy, heavy and the gang in it's other valve-made rival. You won't be hearing any phycopathic shouts of medic here, rather the bland shouts of 'Fire in the hole', but you will get attached to these sorts of things  very quickly. I have hond memories of my first ever game where I basically had a 5 minute onslaught of dying and hearing crazy portuguese people screaming through the mic. I also liked the witty posters that people stick on the walls of maps to keep you constantly having a quiet giggle to yourself. I seem to remember a friend of mine saying after my first game; 'well, thats counter-strike!'.

So should you fork out your hard earned cash when you can get TF2 free of charge? Yes, entirely. I can say this game is micro-transaction free, which is a nice change. I also liked how this game has no real progression system so you always feel the game is balanced, no op weapons here folks! Finally, if you get the 15 pound bundle with garry's mod (another fantasic game), you can save 5 pound whilst getting the CS:S content in GMOD. I think you should get down to the store, don't you?
Greatest game in the Counterstrike franchise, and I dare to say best game released by valve (Other than halflife).

Counter Strike: Source

If you want an honest and accurate review of this game, instead of over-hyped and fallacious fanboy critiques, read on.

[h1]Positives:[/h1]

+ A lot of different firearms to use, such as pistols, shotguns, submachineguns and sniper rifles..great variety.
+ Plenty of multiplayer maps to indulge in with a massive community still playing.
+ Singleplayer mode versus bots, which is fun for anyone and ideal for a relaxing playthrough. I really enjoyed this.

[h1]Negatives:[/h1]

- Overly simplistic and primitive shooting. Iron sight zooming on all weapons is non-existent and only sniper rifles allow a scope zoom. The game relies heavily on crosshairs, which is an outdated idea. Counter Strike: Source was released in 2004, but has never been adjusted with time by developers, so it remains backward.
- This game's multiplayer is not in any way tactical. It is focused on camping, 'bunny-hopping' to avoid bullets and flashbang grenade spamming. This is not skillfull or realistic. 
- The game is not team oriented, despite the very obvious fact you have players on your multiplayer side. Other than that, the teams do not work together or use microphone frequently for communication, so any chances of formulating an assault strategy or defence is utterly futile.
- Poor graphics which haven't been updated since 2004 and it seems, never will be.
- No storyline mode to the game, meaning it is a purely multiplayer or singleplayer versus bots experience. There's no background or explanation for why the counter-terrorists are fighting terrorists, I can only surmise it's because that's their job, but it leaves me dissatisfied. 

Overall Score: 5/10

Counter: Strike Source is a terrible multiplayer game. But, it is a really good singleplayer versus bots game which I had fun with. The multiplayer pulls the score down significantly. You can easily spend over 100 hours replaying maps against bots and enjoying yourself. If you're looking for a good multiplayer First Person Shooter, it's probably a better idea to check out Counter: Strike Global offensive, a far more modernised game than this one, albeit I suspect it will suffer from similar shortcomings.

Counter Strike: Source defines technology. It has many features that will blow a players mind. Since this game is about 10 years old its a very good game that Valve has developed. It has its pros and its cons. But to gamers, it will always be a legendary game that us as a gaming community will not forget.

  Valve offers good games at the right price. Now we have games like Call Of Duty, which will never be victorious in a fight against Counter-Strike. As it has a variety of things to do such as play with bots or get on a server with your friends. But, Counter Strike still has some things that can be fixed, since counter strike is basically developed by the community now. Us as a gaming community cant access the database, that means that we cant patch anything related to bunny hopping. Some gamers say "bunny hopping" is a development of skill, its really not. Its something that Valve doesnt care to fix. But at the same time Counter strike is a good game.

  Compared to some console games, Counter strike demolishes them (games like Call Of Duty). However Counter Strike has not reached its limits. Since the game was abandoned and not a Work-In-Progress anymore, it could loose that classic game position, this is not a negative review or a completely positive. Im just trying to prove a point. You can make this game better Valve.
